item.title: A primer on Mixed-Effects Models: Theory and practice
item.description: When I started my PhD I had to get familiar with Linear Mixed Models very well very quickly. Then I was asked to present what I learnt and prepare this informal tutorial for my colleagues, which I presented on March 10th, 2020 (yes, early pandemic ). This post shares the result. This is not supposed to be taken as a formal guide to linear mixed-effects models, but rather as a semi-coherent compilation of notes and self-suggestions that I considered worth sharing with my lab mates during my early stages of in the PhD.
